noun.description: A chain or manacle used to restrain a prisoner, typically placed around the ankles.
examples: he lay bound with fetters of iron

verb.description: Restrain with chains or manacles, typically around the ankles.
examples: the Supervisor tossed a key to the old slave to unlock the chain that fettered the prisoners together

origin: Old English feter, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch veter a lace, from an Indo-European root shared by foot.
